if three things occur. Number one, the solution exists. Number two, the solution is unique.
Number three, the solution U changes continuously with respect to F. If that is the case,
then the PDE, with its conditions, will be called well-posed, in the sense of Atomor.

the same definition extended to PDEs. And whenever the PDE is not well-posed,
then it will be called ill-posed.
